metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15274 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
security/keys/keyctl.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11.5 does not considerthe case of a NULL payload in conjunction with a nonzero length value,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference and OOPS) via a crafted add_key or keyctl system call, adifferent vulnerability than CVE-2017-12192.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15274` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-87.110
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1065-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1065.73
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1067-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1067.72
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1026.35
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1022-gke - 4.4.0-1022.22
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1022-gke - 4.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-87.110').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
